subject: Real Estate
title: The Four Phases of a Property Cycle
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Four Phases of a Property Cycle.

hook.text: Real estate markets follow a predictable rhythm: recovery, expansion, hyper-supply, then recession.

buildup.text: Recovery is quiet â€” vacancies fall, rents stabilize, but nobody's building yet.

discovery.text: Expansion brings construction booms, rising prices, and easy credit. Everyone feels like a genius.

twist.text: Hyper-supply hits when all those cranes finish at once. Vacancies spike and prices stall.

climax.text: Recession clears the excess. Weak players exit, and the cycle resets for those who waited.

punchline.text: Booms feel permanent. They never are.

quiz.question: What triggers the hyper-supply phase of a property cycle?
options: Too many buildings completing at once
